dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.pushservice.operations.handleid
Class SimpleHandleIdPushOperation

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.lib2.api.util.AbstractExecutableExtension
      dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.pushservice.AbstractPushOperation
          dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.pushservice.AbstractConfigurablePushOperation
              dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.pushservice.operations.handleid.AbstractHandleIdPushOperation
                  dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.pushservice.operations.handleid.SimpleHandleIdPushOperation
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension
Direct Known Subclasses:
GenericUpperLayerHandleIdPushOperation, PduLookupHandleIdCopyPushOperation, PduLookupHandleIdPushOperation
public class SimpleHandleIdPushOperation
extends AbstractHandleIdPushOperation

This implementation of the PushOperation makes a list of handle-ids zero-based-consecutive. This operation supports the following extension-point parameters:

  • moduleId: The id of the module for which to generated handle-ids
  • listPath: Schema-Path to the list with the handle-ids
  • idPath: Path relative to each list entry where the id variable can be found
  • groupBy: Relative path from the list entry to the parameter that is used as grouping key
  • sortOrder: comma separated values that are used as keys in thr groupBy parameter. If entries start with '~' they are interpreted as regexps
  • ignore: comma separated values of group keys that should be ignored. If entries start with '~' they are interpreted as regexps
  • zbcGroups: If not set to false each group starts its ids by zero
  • startingId: If not set to each count starts with zero
  • filterPath: Schema path to an element parameter on which a filter function can be applied
  • filterValues: Parameter providing a comma separated list of values which are passing the filter function
Input to this PushOperation is a HandleIdEvent

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.b

doCanHandle

public boolean doCanHandle(AbstractPushEvent event)
Description copied from class: AbstractPushOperation
Checks if the push operation can handle the given event.

This method must be overridden in implementations of a PushOperation.

The default implementation returns true.

Overrides:
doCanHandle in class AbstractHandleIdPushOperation
Parameters:
event - The event
Returns:
true if the push operation can handle the given event, false if not

This method must be overridden in implementations of a PushOperation.

The default implementation does nothing.

processGroupedHandleIds

protected void processGroupedHandleIds(AbstractPushEvent event,
                                       SimpleHandleIdPushOperation.ParameterSet params,
                                       java.util.Collection<DCtxt> listCtxts)
Calculate handle-ids for a given collection of DCtxt elements. The elements are grouped according to the value of one parameter.

Parameters:
event - Event which triggered handle id calculation
params - parameters describing how the grouping shall be executed
listCtxts - list of elements the handle ids of which shall be calculated
Since:
2008.b

                                                         java.util.Collection<DCtxt> listCtxts)
Calculate handle-ids for a given collection of DCtxt elements. The elements are grouped according to the value of one parameter.

doGetGroupKey

protected java.lang.String doGetGroupKey(AbstractPushEvent event,
                                         DCtxt listEntryCtxt,
                                         java.lang.String groupByParameter)
This method can be overwritten to provide an own engine to get the value of the grouping parameter. The default is to use the groupByParameter as a relative path to the grouping parameter.

Parameters:
event - The event handed in to the operation
listEntryCtxt - The context to the currently processed list entry
groupByParameter - The groupBy
Returns:
The grouping key
Since:
2008.b

doGetNextHandleId

public int doGetNextHandleId(AbstractPushEvent event,
                             DCtxt listEntryCtxt,
                             int lastHandleId)
Calculates the next Handle-Id. This method can be overridden to use a more complex algorithm. The default is lastHandleId+1

Parameters:
listEntryCtxt -
lastHandleId -
Returns:
The next Handle-Id
Since:
2008.b
